statement.p: A fractal is constructed with a horizontal line as the intiator and the following generator:
To help you interpret this drawing, note that _ has width 1, / and \ have width 0.5, and | has width 0. So for example, \_| has width 0.5 + 1 + 0 = 1.5
Determine the fractal dimension of the curve generated by this set up.

answer.p: This generator has width {{scale}} and uses {{pieces}} line segements. So scaling the fractal by a factor of {{scale}} requires {{pieces}} copies of the orginal shape. This means the fractal dimension is \frac{\ln({{pieces}})}{\ln({{scale}})} \approx {{dimension}}
